trialDescription.title: Brazilian pentavalent vaccine
trialDescription.scientificTitle: Immunogenicity and safety of Brazilian combined vaccine against diphtheria, tetanus, pertussis, haemophilus influenzae type B and hepatitis B (DTPw/HB/hib)
trialDescription.studyHypothesis: The Brazilian combined diphtheria, tetanus, pertussis, haemophilus influenzae type B and hepatitis B (DTPw/HB/hib) vaccine is as immunogenic and safe as the current DTPw/Hib and HB vaccines administered separately.
trialDescription.plainEnglishSummary: Not provided at time of registration
trialDescription.primaryOutcome: Antibody titres to diphtheria, tetanus, pertussis, haemophilus influenzae (PRP) and hepatitis B, and seroprotection rate, measured after third dose, shoud be non-inferior to that from the reference vaccines (DTP/Hib and HB vaccines given separately).
trialDescription.secondaryOutcome:
1. Adverse event after each dose shoud be equivalent to reference vaccines
2. Consistency of production evaluated by equivalence in immunogenicity and safety of three lots of the experimental vaccine DTPw/HB/Hib
trialDescription.ethicsApproval: Ethics approval received from the Fiocruz Ethics Committee on the 14th January 2007 (ref: 400/07).

trialDesign.studyDesign: Multicentre, non-inferiority randomised controlled trial, partially blinded.

participants.inclusion: Healthy newborns (newborns and infants up to 7 months of age, of both sexes) whose parents/tutors understand the risk and benefits of the trial and agree to participate with written and informed consent.
participants.exclusion:
Newborns or mothers:
1. Hepatitis B surface antigen (HBsAg) positive
2. Human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) seropositive 
3. With positive serology for syphilis
participants.patientInfoSheet: Not available in web format, please use the contact details below to request a patient information sheet

condition.description: Diphtheria, tetanus, pertussis, hepatitis B and haemophilus influenzae type B diseases

intervention.description:
1. Experimental group: vaccine (DTPw/HB/Hib) at 2, 4 and 6 months of age
2. Control group: DTPw/Hib and HB vaccines in concomitant injections at different sites

Both groups will receive HB vaccine at birth.
intervention.drugNames: Combined diphtheria, tetanus, pertussis, haemophilus influenzae type B and hepatitis B (DTPw/HB/hib) vaccine, DTPw/Hib vaccine, HB vaccine

results.publicationPlan: Not provided at time of registration
